message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.IR, cs.NE. 

This paper proposes a deep learning approach for automatic summarization tasks, which is a common topic in natural language processing (NLP) research. The use of convolutional sequence-to-sequence (ConvS2S) models and self-critical sequence training (SCST) for optimization suggests that the paper may belong to the sub-categories of cs.CL (Computation and Language) and cs.LG (Machine Learning). The incorporation of topic information and word-level alignment also suggests a potential fit for cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.IR (Information Retrieval) sub-categories. Finally, the use of reinforcement training and non-differentiable metric ROUGE may suggest a potential fit for the cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) sub-category.
